text: My name is Eli Litchman.

I'm the CEO and
founder of HydroHaul.

And we're unlocking a cleaner
future powered by hydrogen.

More than 30% of
all emissions come

from what are called
hard-to-abate sectors, which

means that electrification
alone isn't sufficient.

Instead, you need a clean
molecule to decarbonize

and the only viable
option is hydrogen.

Over the next 20 years,
more than $10 trillion

will be invested into
the hydrogen economy.

However, more than 2/3 of that
investment is being directed

to reduce the cost
of production,

despite more than half of the
delivered price of hydrogen

being in its storage,
transportation,
and distribution.

If you want a sustainable
future, you need clean hydrogen.

And for it to succeed, the cost
of the midstream value chain
must come down.
That's where we come in.

HydroHaul is an
innovative solution

that allows you to transport
hydrogen easily using
a proxy carrier molecule.

All you need to know
about how it works

is that our form of hydrogen
is the only one I can carry in

my hand right here, right now
without the risk of literally

blowing up our apartment or at
least poisoning my roommates.

It's safer, more reliable,
and more than 30% cheaper

than anything else that
exists on the market today.

Prior to HBS, I was an advanced
hydrogen jet engine designer

and my co-founder, who was
a PhD in hydrogen storage,

literally built and flew
the first hydrogen fuel
cell-powered airplane.

Together, we have
experience required

to bring this solution
to the market.

We're joined by world
class scientists

from Lawrence Berkeley,
who have demonstrated
the technology in the lab.

We've already raised $70,000
in non-dilutive funding.

And we recently just signed
our first letter of intent

to demonstrate the
technology in the field.

Too much is riding on the
success of a hydrogen economy.

The world cannot and
will not let it fail.

Join us in redefining the
future of hydrogen. Thank you.
